overview: She's a little bit country, a little bit rock 'n' roll, but one thing is certain: Carlene Carter gives her all in this 1983 concert at London's Marquee Club. The daughter of June Carter and stepdaughter of legend Johnny Cash, Carter adopts a forward-looking approach to country music that's made her one of the most innovative performers around. The sultry singer performs tunes including "Meant It for a Minute" and "Love Is a 4-Letter Verb."
title: Carlene Carter: Live in London
